channel.title: SevenAtSevenPolitics
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenPolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Bill Gates’s daughter Phoebe knows she’s a ‘nepo baby’—that made her freshman year even tougher
item.description: Bill Gates's daughter Phoebe shared the scrutiny she felt she was under when starting at Stanford, and the fact her parents refused to let her drop ou...

item.title: Trump advisors argue steep tariffs on countries like Vietnam and Cambodia are needed to erase trade deficits and rework supply chains. The economics say that’s going to be a long shot
item.description: Despite promises made by Southeast Asia governments, consumers in the region may not be able to afford American-made products.

item.title: How Taxpayer-Funded Censorship Tools Could Manipulate What Americans See About Vaccines, Raw Milk, And More
item.description: The federal government incubated a host of online censorship programs, several of which are still operating under leftist groups.

item.title: Trump hauls in millions for House GOP 2026 war chest as Dems taunt they are 'running scared'

item.title: Judge Boasberg cancels planned hearing to review Trump deportations
item.description: A federal judge has canceled a planned hearing on the Trump administration's use of an 18th century law to deport foreign nationals after the Supreme ...

item.title: Yes, Bring Back the Woolly Mammoth
item.description: The company that brought the dire wolf back from extinction wants to do the same for the dodo, Tasmanian tiger, and woolly mammoth. And why not?

item.title: Milwaukee Officials Blocked Windows, Preventing Observers From Seeing Them Process Ballots
item.description: ‘Why are you covering the windows? Why did you have mail bins stacked in front of the glass and obscuring people’s view?'

item.title: Why Are There So Many Aviation Accidents?
item.description: Recent aviation tragedies and near misses do not come as a surprise. The path to safety failure has been years in the making.

item.title: Supreme Court lifts order blocking deportations under 18th-century wartime law

item.title: DHS moves to speed border wall construction, waives Endangered Species Act, Clean Air Act
item.description: Homeland Security Secretary Kristi Noem waived some of the country's most iconic environmental protection laws Monday as she sought to cut through del...

item.title: Supporters defend Trump’s pick to control America’s nuclear arsenal before Senate grilling
item.description: President Donald Trump's nominee for National Nuclear Security Administrator, Brandon Williams, is appearing before the Senate Armed Services Committe...

item.title: Joe Manchin, the former Democrat criticized for often siding with Republicans, will release a memoir later this year called ‘Dead Center’
item.description: The former senator's book “Dead Center: In Defense of Common Sense” will be released Sept. 16.

item.title: Musk spars with White House advisor Peter Navarro: ‘Dumber than a sack of bricks’

item.title: Supreme Court OKs gang suspect deportations to El Salvador, with some new limits
item.description: The Supreme Court delivered a major victory to President Trump on Monday, erasing a lower court ruling that had blocked him from deporting Tren de Ara...

item.title: Markets get some much-needed relief as countries begin negotiating with Trump over tariffs
item.description: The Dow was up 1,300 points and the S&P 500 rose 3.7% Tuesday morning.

item.title: Why I sold my family’s century-plus-old company to my employees
item.description: As business owners, we don't need the last nickel. We should be open to sharing some of the wealth.

item.title: Colorado Democrats ‘Silence’ State GOP To Push Genital Mutilation And Taxpayer-Funded Abortion
item.description: Colorado Democrats want to kill as many babies and mutilate as many children as possible, and make Coloradans pay for it.

item.title: The U.K.’s Abortion ‘Buffer Zone’ Tyranny Is Buffeting Free Speech
item.description: As censorship mounts, Britain must decide whether it will continue down this authoritarian path or reclaim its role as a defender of basic liberties.

item.title: How Trump’s Antitrust Agenda Can Tackle Some Of America’s Biggest Problems
item.description: By working with U.S. companies, rather than against them, the administration can preserve American values, security, and global leadership.

item.title: Congress Should End Trump’s Trade War
item.description: It was no accident that the Founders placed the power to tax, tariff, and legislate in the hands of the legislature.

item.title: New Navy chief 'regrets' costly missile strikes against Houthis, pushes for cheaper Red Sea defense
item.description: Adm. James Kilby says expensive Red Sea missile defenses are not sustainable and calls on the military-industrial base to speed up cheaper munitions p...

item.title: Peter Navarro’s Moment
item.description: He finally has the attention of the world, but his over-the-top tariff rhetoric isn’t very convincing.

item.title: The Grand Strategic Folly of a War on Trade
item.description: America was born as a maritime nation and grew to become a hegemon. Our grand strategy can’t and shouldn’t aim at isolation.

item.title: Trump on ending Israel tariffs: 'Maybe not'
item.description: President Trump wasn't sold on reducing or eliminating tariffs on Israel even after Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu promised to eliminate th...

item.title: Tariffs target trade deficits, not direct duties on U.S.
item.description: President Trump's "reciprocal" tariffs are based on trade deficits rather than the tariffs imposed on U.S. goods by other countries.
